intro: Alchornea anamariae, commonly known as the Anamariae cudweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest understories. It has a compact growth habit and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
